name: Margaret Primrose

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Thank you for dealing with those Ghouls. You're a real hero.{self important snob showing uncharacteristic genuine appreciation}

topics.topic_text: You ever go down to the basement?
topics.response_text: I haven't. But every so often Gustavo takes someone down there to work on the generators when we lose power. That hasn't happened in awhile, though.

topics.topic_text: What's it like living at Tenpenny Tower?
topics.response_text: Well, I feel a lot safer now that those Ghouls have stopped bothering us. That's for sure.{self important snob showing uncharacteristic genuine appreciation}

topics.topic_text: The only thing a Ghoul should have to prove is how fast it can die.
topics.response_text: That's rather extreme, though near enough to the truth. Talk to Gustavo. He might be able to use you in the fight against the Ghouls.{mildly shocked}

topics.topic_text: Yeah, I wouldn't want Ghouls living here either.
topics.response_text: There must be something we can do. Talk to Gustavo, he might have some way for you to assist us in dealing with the problem.

topics.topic_text: I think they've proven something just staying alive in that condition.
topics.response_text: I guess I never thought of it that way. It's probably really hard just living day to day like that. Now I feel a little ashamed.{sincere}

topics.topic_text: What's it like living at Tenpenny Tower?
topics.response_text: It's a great place to live. I've always dreamed of giving people fresh meals, and a place to relax and enjoy a good conversation or two.{with pride at her social standing}

topics.topic_text: Running a cafe can't be easy.
topics.response_text: Indeed! Everyone who lives here has worked hard to get here.{gloating}

topics.topic_text: Not everyone is as lucky as you.
topics.response_text: Lucky? Perhaps I should feel lucky. But really, we've all worked hard to get what we have. I think it's fair to say we DESERVE to live here.{justifying her privelaged life}

topics.topic_text: Whatever.
topics.response_text: You're lucky they even let you in here. I'm surprised they did, since it will only encourage those Ghouls who want to live here.{with mild disdain}

topics.topic_text: Those Ghouls have you stressed out, too?
topics.response_text: Chief Gustavo assures us that he's increased the number of the security team, and will kill any zombies on sight.{self important snob brushing off concern for her safety}

topics.topic_text: I might be able to do something.
topics.response_text: Really? That'd be wonderful. Talk to Chief Gustavo about it.{surprised but happy someone is taking charge}

topics.topic_text: I wonder if Ghouls will like your cooking?
topics.response_text: I hope I don't have to find out... though, everyone loves my cooking.{self important indignation}

topics.topic_text: <Say nothing.>
topics.response_text: Those Ghouls got you scared too, huh?{confiding}

topics.topic_text: How would you feel about having a few Ghoul neighbors?
topics.response_text: Oh, I know you've been lobbying for those Ghouls... and I've already been thinking it over. I guess I would be willing to give it a try.{hesitant but sincere}

topics.topic_text: You're right. Ghouls are disgusting.
topics.response_text: I agree, though I wonder if they can help it. They seem rather pathetic, don't they? It seems like a horrible way to have to live.{snob losing prejudice}

topics.topic_text: What if they kept themselves clean and didn't bother anyone?
topics.response_text: I don't know. As long as they don't cause trouble. And they'd have to try to fit in with our established community.{letting go of prejudice}

topics.topic_text: Would you tell Mister Tenpenny that you wouldn't mind Ghoul neighbors?
topics.response_text: I guess so. Sure.

topics.topic_text: Perhaps.
topics.response_text: You're a little weird, aren't you?{self important snob}

topics.topic_text: Tell me about Allistair Tenpenny.
topics.response_text: Every day it's the same thing. The man has no imagination with his meals.

topics.topic_text: And a pretty smile it is!
topics.response_text: Very kind of you to say so. Thank you!{gladly accepting a compliment}

topics.topic_text: I don't need a smile. What I need is some food.
topics.response_text: Most people consider mistreating food service providers as an invitation to get a little something unexpected in their meal.{warning an unruly guest}

topics.topic_text: Whatever you say.
topics.response_text: Well. Like I said. Take a seat anywhere, except at Mister Tenpenny's table.

topics.topic: TenpennyVendorI'd like to do business with you.
topics.topic_text: Can I get something to eat?
topics.response_text: What are you in the mood for?

conversation.response_text: Yeah. I know. It's just... Well, I've been busy.{tired}
Thank you for saying so, sir. It's always my great pleasure. If you'd ever like to try another dish, I have an extensive menu of delicacies.{flattered and hinting that her talents are under utilized}
Of course Mister Tenpenny.{covering up her hurt feelings}
Think I'll take a moment for myself, and eat a little something.{hungry and on his way to get food}
I think I'll turn in for the night.{tired and heading off to bed}
Have a good one!{(sincere) self important cafe owner}
You're up to something. I can tell.{confused and slightly suspicious}

description:
Margaret Primrose is a 68 year-old Hispanic Female.

Margaret Primrose is the elderly proprietor of Café Beau Monde, the exclusive dining establishment within Tenpenny Tower. With weathered hands and a warm smile, she has been serving the tower's residents for years, preparing meals from pre-War recipes passed down through her family. Her café is the only dining option within the tower, operating from 6:00 AM to 9:00 PM daily. Margaret takes pride in her work, seeing it as a way to bring a touch of normalcy to the otherwise austere life in the tower. When not working, she can usually be found in her small room on the tower's lower levels, often reminiscing about the world before the Great War.

Margaret Primrose's Personality: Margaret is kind and patient, with a maternal demeanor toward the tower's residents. She values tradition and normalcy in a world gone mad. Despite her age, she maintains a strong work ethic and takes pride in her cooking. She can be somewhat reserved with strangers but opens up to those who show genuine interest in her stories or food. She has a particular soft spot for the tower's children, often preparing special treats for them when she can spare the ingredients.

Margaret Primrose's Backstory: Margaret was born in the pre-War era to a Hispanic family living in California. Her mother, a passionate but not always skilled cook, taught Margaret the basics of cooking from a young age. Margaret showed a natural talent for the culinary arts and honed her skills over the years. She was married briefly in her early twenties but lost her husband in the chaos following the Great War. Alone in the wasteland, she eventually made her way to the East Coast and found employment in Tenpenny Tower when it was first established. Over time, she saved enough to open her small café, which has become an integral part of tower life. Her mother's recipes form the basis of her menu, though she has adapted them to work with the limited ingredients available in the wasteland.
